DOC.brief_title: A Comparison Seated Thoracic Manipulation Targeted Supine Thoracic Manipulation Cervical Flexion Motion Pain
DOC.detailed_description: DESIGN : Randomized clinical trial OBJECTIVES : To determine effectiveness seat thoracic manipulation versus target supine thoracic manipulation cervical spine pain flexion range motion . There evidence thoracic spine manipulation effective treatment patient cervical spine pain . This evidence include variety technique manipulate thoracic spine . While effective , research compare technique determine produce best outcomes . METHODS : Thirty-nine patient cervical spine pain randomly assign either seat thoracic manipulation target supine thoracic manipulation group . Pain flexion range motion measure take intervention .
DOC.criteria: Inclusion criterion require patient 1860 year old primary complaint neck pain identification red flag suggestive nonmusculoskeletal etiology , history whiplash injury within six week initial visit , diagnosis cervical spine stenosis , central nervous system involvement , sign nerve root compression ( two follow limited level : strength , sensation , reflex ) .
